lead_paragraph: We publish to-day the terms of the treaty signed at Berlin, on the 7th inst., between Prussia and Hanover to effect the long-pending and often-attempted union of the commercial leagues or associations to which those States severally belong. The result is of considerable importance, not only to the commercial policy of the Zollverein, but to the general political interests of Northern Germany.

headline.main: FOREIGN GLEANINGS.; The Commercial Treaty between Prussia and Berlin. The American Flag in Europe. The Electric Telegraph in Europe. The Executions at Cuba. Miscellaneous.
